intro: Calycophyllum obovatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed calycophyllum, is a tropical flowering plant belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its large, obovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green in color. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Calycophyllum obovatum is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks.
